text: The Château du Grand-Blottereau is a historic pavilion in Nantes, Loire- Atlantique, Pays de la Loire, France. ==History== The pavilion was completed in 1747 to the design of architect Jean-Baptiste Ceineray, for Gabriel Michel, a Director of the French East India Company.Le Grand-Blottereau, son château, son écrin de verdure, Ouest-France, December 2, 2014 It was restored from 1988 to 1993. ==Architectural significance== It has been listed as an official monument since 1992.French Ministry of Culture: Château du Grand-Blottereau ==References== Category:Châteaux in Loire-Atlantique Category:Monuments historiques of Pays de la Loire Category:Houses completed in 1747 Category:Buildings and structures in Nantes
title: Château du Grand-Blottereau
